pages.text: Upgrades augment and improve the operation of existing machines!$(p)Specific upgrades are covered in other chapters of the book, so they are not mentioned here. It's worth experimenting to see what all the upgrades do!

pages.title: Gearbox Compatability
pages.text: This special upgrade works in the Gearbox!$(p)It expands the acceptable fuel from only Empowered Fuel to accept any burnable material!

pages.title: Gearbox Efficiency
pages.text: This upgrade, at the cost of slowing down operation, increases the fuel efficiency on Gearbox fuel extremely.

pages.title: Gearbox Limiter
pages.text: This upgrade will stop the Gearbox from running unless there is an operation to be done.$(p)This allows you to leave fuel in it without it wasting it.

pages.title: Item Pipe Filter
pages.text: This upgrade will incrase the available filter space on the Item Pipe, unlocking up to 9 filter slots with 3 of these upgrades.

pages.title: Item Pipe Stack
pages.text: This upgrade will increase the stack size per operation on the Item Pipe, all the way up to a full stack per operation with three upgrades!

pages.title: Item Pipe Redstone
pages.text: This upgrade will unlock Redstone control on the Item Pipe!

pages.title: Speed Upgrade
pages.text: This Speed Upgrade is almost universal in machines which accept upgrades.$(p)This will generally increase processing speed, at cost of either power or fuel.

pages.title: Machine Conservation
pages.text: This upgrade, when placed into some machines, will reduce or eliminate the amount of resources consumed to give the output.

pages.title: Machine Extra Output
pages.text: This upgrade, when placed into some machines, will increase the odds of receiving more of either the primary or secondary outputs.

pages.title: Purifier Filtering
pages.text: This upgrade is required in the Purifier for all recipes which do not use Gravel and Sand in the recipe, for example in the craft for Attuned Titanium.
